title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #322: Representations as Sums of k-th Powers**

**Question:** Does r_k(n) > n^c for infinitely many n?

**Status:** PARTIALLY SOLVED
- k = 3: YES, Mahler (1936) proved c = 1/12 works
- k ≥ 4: OPEN

Connected to Waring's problem and the Hardy-Littlewood Hypothesis K.
mathContext: r_k(n) counts representations n = x₁^k + x₂^k + ... + x_k^k. Hypothesis K predicted r_k(n) = n^{o(1)}.

title: k-th Powers
content:
**kthPowers k:**

The set of k-th powers: {n | n = m^k for some m ∈ ℕ}.

Examples:
- k = 2: {0, 1, 4, 9, 16, ...} (squares)
- k = 3: {0, 1, 8, 27, 64, ...} (cubes)

title: Representation Count r_k(n)
content:
**representationCount k n:**

The number of ways to write n as a sum of exactly k many k-th powers:

n = x₁^k + x₂^k + ... + x_k^k

This is the central function studied in the problem.

title: Hypothesis K
content:
**hypothesisK k:**

Hardy-Littlewood Hypothesis K: r_k(n) = n^{o(1)} for k ≥ 3.

Formalized as: ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N, ∀ n ≥ N, r_k(n) < n^ε.

This would mean representations grow slower than any polynomial.
mathContext: Proposed in the 1920s as part of the Partitio Numerorum program.

title: Hypothesis K Fails
content:
**hypothesisK_fails k:**

The negation: ∃ c > 0, ∀ N, ∃ n ≥ N with r_k(n) > n^c.

This means infinitely many n have polynomial lower bound on representations.

title: Mahler's Theorem (1936)
content:
**mahler_theorem:**

Hypothesis K is FALSE for k = 3 (cubes).

There exist infinitely many n with r_3(n) ≫ n^{1/12}.

This sensationally disproved the Hardy-Littlewood conjecture for cubes.
mathContext: Mahler's proof uses algebraic number theory and properties of cubic forms.

title: k ≥ 4 Status
content:
**erdos_conjecture_k4:**

Erdős conjectured Hypothesis K fails for ALL k ≥ 4.

**STATUS: OPEN**

Whether r_k(n) > n^c for infinitely many n when k ≥ 4 is unknown.

title: Erdős-Chowla Bound
content:
**erdos_chowla_bound:**

For all k ≥ 3, there exist infinitely many n with:

r_k(n) ≫ n^{c/log log n}

This is WEAKER than disproving Hypothesis K (needs polynomial bound).

Independently proved by Erdős and Chowla in 1936.

title: Hypothesis K*
content:
**hypothesisKStar k:**

Hardy-Littlewood's weaker conjecture:

Σ_{n≤N} r_k(n)² ≪ N^{1+ε} for all ε > 0.

Erdős-Graham: 'Probably true but no doubt very deep. Would suffice for most applications.'
mathContext: K* allows polynomial spikes in individual r_k(n), controlling only the average.

title: Summary: PARTIALLY SOLVED
content:
**erdos_322:**

**STATUS:** PARTIALLY SOLVED

**SOLVED (k=3):** Hypothesis K fails with c = 1/12 (Mahler)

**OPEN (k≥4):** Erdős conjectured K fails but unproven

**KNOWN for all k≥3:** Weaker Erdős-Chowla bound

**CONJECTURED:** Hypothesis K* probably true
